testDesc: This test will help you understand the status of your key health indicators. It helps in early detection of common chronic & lifestyle health conditions related to thyroid, diabetes, liver, kidney, heart and blood.

testsInclude.name: Complete Haemogram (CBC+ESR)
testsInclude.desp: A complete haemogram evaluates your overall health and detects a wide range of infections and potential diseases. It counts your Red Blood Cells, which carry oxygen, White Blood Cells, which fight off diseases, and Platelets, which help in clotting when you hurt yourself. ESR aids in detection of certain chronic infections and cancers.

testsInclude.name: Glucose - Fasting Blood (FBS)
testsInclude.desp: A glucose test is used to determine the amount of glucose in the blood. It is mainly used in screening for pre-diabetes or diabetes.

testsInclude.name: Glycosylated Haemoglobin (HbA1c)
testsInclude.desp: This test evaluates the average amount of glucose in the blood over the last 2 to 3 months. It monitors blood glucose levels for already diagnosed diabetics so that the risk of complications related to it can be assessed and prevented. It can also be used to assess predisposition to diabetes.

testDesc: This pack checks for Vitamin B12 and vitamin D levels in your body. It is recommended for people showing symptoms of Vitamin B12 deficiency include low energy levels, muscle weakness or mouth ulcers, bone pain.

testsInclude.name: Vitamin B12
testsInclude.desp: A deficiency of vitamin B12 can cause lack of energy and tiredness. Vitamin B12 works closely with vitamin B9 to help make red blood cells and to make nerves and iron work better in the body.

testsInclude.name: Vitamin D Total
testsInclude.desp: Vitamin D helps your body absorb calcium. Vitamin D deficiency is linked to fatigue, bone and muscle pain, as well as getting ill more often than usual.

testDesc: Thyroid secretes hormones which influence the metabolic rate, protein synthesis and development of your body. This test checks the amount of the following critical hormones: T3, T4, TSH.

testsInclude.name: Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH)
testsInclude.desp: This test is done to screen for and diagnose thyroid disorders. It is done if you have symptoms of hyperthyroidism like weight loss, nervousness, tremors or hypothyroidism like weight gain, constipation, fatigue, cold intolerance.

testsInclude.name: Thyroxine Total (T4)
testsInclude.desp: A thyroxine test helps diagnose disorders of the thyroid. Thyroxine, also known as T4, is a type of thyroid hormone. This test measures the level of T4 in your blood. Too much or too little T4 can indicate thyroid disease.

testsInclude.name: Triiodothyronine Total (T3)
testsInclude.desp: The Triiodothyronine test is performed to detect and diagnose disorders of the thyroid gland including hypothyroidism and to evaluate the effectiveness of the treatment.

testDesc: Understand your fitness from the inside out. This pack will help you understand your vitals, hormones and vitamin levels, which will help you understand how to plan your workout journey accordingly.

testsInclude.name: Complete Haemogram (CBC+ESR)
testsInclude.desp: A complete haemogram evaluates your overall health and detects a wide range of infections and potential diseases. It counts your Red Blood Cells, which carry oxygen, White Blood Cells, which fight off diseases, and Platelets, which help in clotting when you hurt yourself. ESR aids in detection of certain chronic infections and cancers.

testsInclude.name: Glucose - Fasting Blood (FBS)
testsInclude.desp: A glucose test is used to determine the amount of glucose in the blood. It is mainly used in screening for pre-diabetes or diabetes.

testsInclude.name: Kidney Function Test (KFT)
testsInclude.desp: Your kidneys filter out waste materials from the blood and control the levels of water and minerals in the body. In addition, they are critical to the production of Vitamin D, RBCs and hormones that regulate your blood pressure.

testDesc: Understand your fitness from the inside out. This pack will help you understand your vitals, hormones and vitamin levels, which will help you understand how to plan your workout journey accordingly.

testsInclude.name: Complete Haemogram (CBC+ESR)
testsInclude.desp: A complete haemogram evaluates your overall health and detects a wide range of infections and potential diseases. It counts your Red Blood Cells, which carry oxygen, White Blood Cells, which fight off diseases, and Platelets, which help in clotting when you hurt yourself. ESR aids in detection of certain chronic infections and cancers.

testsInclude.name: Glucose - Fasting Blood (FBS)
testsInclude.desp: A glucose test is used to determine the amount of glucose in the blood. It is mainly used in screening for pre-diabetes or diabetes.

testsInclude.name: Kidney Function Test (KFT)
testsInclude.desp: Your kidneys filter out waste materials from the blood and control the levels of water and minerals in the body. In addition, they are critical to the production of Vitamin D, RBCs and hormones that regulate your blood pressure.

testDesc: Iron is an essential trace element and nutrient that is necessary to maintain life. It is an important part of haemoglobin, which carries oxygen throughout your body. Low iron levels can cause fatigue, shortness of breath, anxiety and head pain.

testsInclude.name: Ferritin
testsInclude.desp: Ferritin is the storage form of iron in the body. Iron is released from ferritin when the body needs it. This test measures how much iron is stored in your body. When your iron level is low, your body will pull iron out of storage to use.

testsInclude.name: Iron
testsInclude.desp: Iron is a mineral in your body which is required to make red blood cells and is also an important part of haemoglobin, a protein in your blood that helps carry oxygen from your lungs to the rest of your body. Too little (anemia) or too much (iron overload) iron in your system is harmful for your body.

testsInclude.name: Percentage Transferrin Saturation
testsInclude.desp: When iron absorption is abnormally high, transferrin proteins become more saturated with iron. An elevated TS value therefore reflects an increase in iron absorption.

testDesc: Diabetes is a long-term condition that causes high blood sugar levels, along with several other associated symptoms like frequent urination, intense thirst and hunger, weight gain, unusual weight loss and fatigue. This pack helps in monitoring blood glucose levels. It is recommended for people who are diabetic, pre-diabetic, or have a family history of diabetes, heart disease or obesity

testsInclude.name: Glucose - Fasting Blood (FBS)
testsInclude.desp: A glucose test is used to determine the amount of glucose in the blood. It is mainly used in screening for pre-diabetes or diabetes.

testsInclude.name: Glycosylated Haemoglobin (HbA1c)
testsInclude.desp: This test evaluates the average amount of glucose in the blood over the last 2 to 3 months. It monitors blood glucose levels for already diagnosed diabetics so that the risk of complications related to it can be assessed and prevented. It can also be used to assess predisposition to diabetes.

testDesc: This pack evaluates various health parameters, which can have an impact on your immunity levels.

testsInclude.name: Complete Haemogram (CBC+ESR)
testsInclude.desp: A complete haemogram evaluates your overall health and detects a wide range of infections and potential diseases. It counts your Red Blood Cells, which carry oxygen, White Blood Cells, which fight off diseases, and Platelets, which help in clotting when you hurt yourself. ESR aids in detection of certain chronic infections and cancers.

testsInclude.name: Creatinine
testsInclude.desp: Creatinine is a waste product that forms when creatine breaks down and is then filtered out by the Kidneys through urine. This test is done to evaluate the health of Kidneys. It can be done as a part of basic metabolic panel or when you have signs of Kidney disease like swelling of face, ankle, lower back pain, changes in urine output etc.

testsInclude.name: Ferritin
testsInclude.desp: Ferritin is the storage form of iron in the body. Iron is released from ferritin when the body needs it. This test measures how much iron is stored in your body. When your iron level is low, your body will pull iron out of storage to use.

testDesc: This pack is recommended for both men and women with hair loss symptoms to identify any deficiencies. It checks for the vitamin, mineral and hormonal levels in your body. These reports help your trichologist to determine the course of your treatment.

testsInclude.name: Ferritin
testsInclude.desp: Ferritin is the storage form of iron in the body. Iron is released from ferritin when the body needs it. This test measures how much iron is stored in your body. When your iron level is low, your body will pull iron out of storage to use.

testsInclude.name: Thyroid Stimulating Hormone (TSH)
testsInclude.desp: This test is done to screen for and diagnose thyroid disorders. It is done if you have symptoms of hyperthyroidism like weight loss, nervousness, tremors or hypothyroidism like weight gain, constipation, fatigue, cold intolerance.

testsInclude.name: Vitamin B12
testsInclude.desp: A deficiency of vitamin B12 can cause lack of energy and tiredness. Vitamin B12 works closely with vitamin B9 to help make red blood cells and to make nerves and iron work better in the body.

testDesc: This pack is recommended for anyone experiencing bone pain, inactivity and stiffness. It screens for underlying medical conditions which can be reviewed by your Orthopaedic doctor.

testsInclude.name: Alkaline Phosphatase (ALP)
testsInclude.desp: ALP is an enzyme found in several tissues in the body, majorly in bone and Liver. Elevated levels of ALP in the blood indicate Liver damage, blockage of the bile ducts or a bone disease.

testsInclude.name: Calcium
testsInclude.desp: A blood calcium test is recommended to screen for, diagnose, and monitor a range of conditions relating to the bones, heart, nerves, muscles, Kidneys, thyroid and teeth.

testsInclude.name: Phosphorus, Serum
testsInclude.desp: This test determines phosphorus levels in the body and aids in the diagnosis of conditions caused by abnormally high or low levels of phosphorus.

testDesc: The liver helps your body get rid of harmful toxins. Poor liver health can lead to chronic disease, unwanted weight gain and loss of energy. Here, we test the levels of various enzymes and proteins in your blood.

testsInclude.name: Alanine Aminotransferase (SGPT)
testsInclude.desp: ALT is an enzyme found mostly in the cells of the Liver and Kidney. In healthy individuals, ALT levels in the blood are low. When the Liver is damaged, excess ALT is released into the blood, which helps in early detection of Liver damage.

testsInclude.name: Albumin
testsInclude.desp: Albumin is a type of protein produced in Liver. It is a carrier protein for many small molecules/ ions and keeps fluid from leaking out of your blood vessels.

testsInclude.name: Albumin/Globulin Ratio
testsInclude.desp: The A/G ratio is calculated from measured Total Protein, Albumin and calculated Globulin (Total Protein - Albumin). Because disease states affect the relative amounts of Albumin and Globulin, the A/G ratio may provide a clue as to the cause of the change in Protein levels.

testDesc: This pack screens for Typhoid, Malaria, Dengue and other causes of fever. It is recommended for those experiencing fever, body pain, headache, loose motion or chills for more than 2 days.

testsInclude.name: CRP Quantitative (C-Reactive Protein)
testsInclude.desp: This test measures the level of C-Reactive Protein (CRP) in your blood. CRP is a protein secreted by the liver in response to inflammation or infection. Elevated levels of CRP can indicate viral or bacterial infection and tissue injury.

testsInclude.name: Complete Haemogram (CBC+ESR)
testsInclude.desp: A complete haemogram evaluates your overall health and detects a wide range of infections and potential diseases. It counts your Red Blood Cells, which carry oxygen, White Blood Cells, which fight off diseases, and Platelets, which help in clotting when you hurt yourself. ESR aids in detection of certain chronic infections and cancers.

testsInclude.name: Dengue IgG & IgM
testsInclude.desp: This test helps diagnose a current or a recent infection by detecting the presence of antibodies produced by the body in response to a dengue fever infection.

testDesc: Assess the status of your liver and pancreatic function due to your alcohol habits. This test can help your physician advise safe limits for your consumption.

testsInclude.name: Amylase
testsInclude.desp: This test is a marker of pancreatic disease and is used to diagnose or monitor a problem with pancreas, including pancreatitis, an inflammation of the pancreas.

testsInclude.name: Complete Haemogram (CBC+ESR)
testsInclude.desp: A complete haemogram evaluates your overall health and detects a wide range of infections and potential diseases. It counts your Red Blood Cells, which carry oxygen, White Blood Cells, which fight off diseases, and Platelets, which help in clotting when you hurt yourself. ESR aids in detection of certain chronic infections and cancers.

testsInclude.name: Glucose - Fasting Blood (FBS)
testsInclude.desp: A glucose test is used to determine the amount of glucose in the blood. It is mainly used in screening for pre-diabetes or diabetes.

testDesc: This test helps in diagnosing haemoglobin deficiency or Anemia which can cause fatigue, weakness or lack of concentration. Common causes of these symptoms are nutritional deficiency, malnutrition or ongoing blood loss from the body.

testsInclude.name: Iron Screening (Ferritin,Iron,TIBC,PTS)
testsInclude.desp: Iron is an essential trace element and nutrient that is necessary to maintain life. It is an important part of haemoglobin, which carries oxygen throughout your body. Low iron levels can cause fatigue, shortness of breath, anxiety and head pain.

testsInclude.name: Complete Haemogram (CBC+ESR)
testsInclude.desp: A complete haemogram evaluates your overall health and detects a wide range of infections and potential diseases. It counts your Red Blood Cells, which carry oxygen, White Blood Cells, which fight off diseases, and Platelets, which help in clotting when you hurt yourself. ESR aids in detection of certain chronic infections and cancers.

testsInclude.name: Vitamin B9 (Folic Acid)
testsInclude.desp: This test determines a cause of anemia or neuropathy, to evaluate nutritional status or to monitor the effectiveness of folate deficiency treatment.

testDesc: This pack screens for underlying medical conditions associated with obesity. Anyone with recent weight gain, metabolic issues and high BMI are recommended to take this test and review with a physician.

testsInclude.name: Glucose - Fasting Blood (FBS)
testsInclude.desp: A glucose test is used to determine the amount of glucose in the blood. It is mainly used in screening for pre-diabetes or diabetes.

testsInclude.name: Glycosylated Haemoglobin (HbA1c)
testsInclude.desp: This test evaluates the average amount of glucose in the blood over the last 2 to 3 months. It monitors blood glucose levels for already diagnosed diabetics so that the risk of complications related to it can be assessed and prevented. It can also be used to assess predisposition to diabetes.

testsInclude.name: Insulin - Fasting
testsInclude.desp: Insulin is a hormone secreted from pancreas and helps the cells to utilise glucose. This test is recommended in diabetes, PCOD/ PCOS and metabolic syndromes.

testDesc: Confirm your pregnancy with this blood test. Get this test done couple of days after your missed period.

testsInclude.name: Beta Human Chorionic Gonodotropin
testsInclude.desp: This test diagnoses pregnancy and aids in the investigation of suspected ectopic pregnancy. It also is also helpful in the first trimester for screening of genetic diseases like Downs syndrome. This test also helps your doctor diagnose certain types of tumors.
